title: Equilibrium flow: From Snapshots to Dynamics
summary: This work introduces the Equilibrium flow method, a framework that learns continuous dynamics preserving a given pattern distribution. It investigates how static patterns from underlying dynamical systems, such as cellular snapshots or celestial distributions, constrain and allow for the recovery of their underlying dynamics.
usefulness_reason: Score 60 assigned because the paper discusses recovering underlying dynamics from static patterns, which can be interpreted as spatio-temporal analysis of point-like data (e.g., celestial distributions), even if it doesn't explicitly use 'point process' terminology. The focus on dynamics and patterns implies spatio-temporal considerations.
